iowa.caption: On a walk with my dad. Talking about life and how we got to this moment. I landed in Iowa November 21, 2025 and it was about 70 degrees. Ha! Ha! My dad and I have taken walks together for as long as I can remember. I think I get my joy of walks from him actually.

It took me entirely too long to find this exact location. I wanted to show my dad this cool wooden path that felt like it was hovering over a secret pond. The road I usually drove down was blocked off and we came from another way but I was determined to show my dad and eventually found it. Sadly, the pond was gone and nothing was left but dead brush and it didn't look so magical anymore.
Walking on this secret wooden path leads out to really the middle of nowhere. Train tracks on the left, a country road on the right and a little windmill and garden pavilion
My dad and I managed to find a little pond on this same walk. Upside down or rightside up?

Such a sucker for a good reflection. To my surprise, my dad had never visited these trails and was seeing all of this for the first time. Despite having spent the past 20+ years living in the Cedar Rapids area. I was pretty excited to share this with him.
Now it was my dads turn to show me something he thought was cool. "Kris, you want to see a huge split rock?" and with that, we were back in Marion, IA where I grew up.

The sunset was exploding before our very eyes and we both are drawn to the beauty of it. It's always a great feeling to share a passion with someone else, I would say taking photos of the sunset is one my dad and I have always shared.
Obviously, I cannot get enough! Iowa sunsets are peaceful, quiet, almost holy moments where you feel like you are seeing Gods 'Welcome Home' sign.
If you were on the edge of your seat to see this giant spit rock that resides in Marion, IA here is your chance! Right off Hwy 13.
My dad and I stopped for acai bowls on our way back home. It was a perfect ending to a perfect day.

My daughter and I planned to do a family photoshoot and she wanted to wear black and white. Her girlfriend Erikka was going to take all the photos however, things didn't work out as planned and the three of us found the night already upon us so we headed downtown to see if Cedar Rapids had better Christmas decorations than Marion. The answer: definitely NOT!
Couple photoshoot for the win! We ate dinner at 'The Black Sheep' restaurant and went for martinis after at 'Bartini' a new hip spot in Cedar Rapids next to the river.
Love covers a multitude of sins - 1 Peter 4:8.
Welcome to Cedar Rapids. Now this is a welcome sign!
It's never goodbye, it's always see you later.
